alert.note: Alert for Lee (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 8:33AM CDT until August 08 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following area, Lee. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Minor flooding of roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 832 AM CDT, doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen, with thunderstorms ongoing. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dixon, Amboy, Franklin Grove, Ashton, Paw Paw, Sublette, Woodhaven Lakes, Compton, Nelson, West Brooklyn, Harmon, Woodland Shores, Lee Center, Eldena and Nachusa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
